result.execSummary:
The defendant Chance R Mervosh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chance R Mervosh is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chance R Mervosh was found guilty of Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chance R Mervosh in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Chance R Mervosh in custody.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
As to count 1:
Court ordered charge amended to Theft pursuant to s. 63.042 Wis. Stats. to which Defendant plead guilty. Court finds defendant guilty of amended charge.  Court orders a forfeiture in the amount of $250 including costs to be paid by 01-13-2017 or civil Judgment.  Cash Bail on to apply.

As to counts 2, 3, 4, 5:
On the state motion, court ordered counts 2,3,4,5 Dismissed.

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court, defendant Chance R Mervosh not in court, in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense counsel is in trial in Br. 18.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with MIRINDA B., the addresses listed on the criminal complaint and No violent contact with: SIMONE M AND CHRISTOPHER S.

Defendant Chance R Mervosh in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Chance R Mervosh in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hannah Dugan, Branch 31.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
